Entering The Conflict Zone

By James Bithell

How do you travel in Israel and Palestine, one of the most complicated, yet interesting regions in the world? (Thumbnail credit All photos: (c) Ailsa Wright 2012)

The Angels' Share

The film, in its disscussion of the poor and disenfranchised of Glasgow's council houses, does not attempt to justify the actions of the individuals that led them to community service but neither does it attempt to villify them

The Hot List 19.06.12

By James Bithell

The Hot List: Aigle Wellies, plaited hair, Azealia Banks, and Caitlin Charles

Interview: The Needle Drop

TND founder Anthony Fantano talks to Rory Foster about music and music. And more music. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: The Needle Drop)

Interview: The Mystery Jets

Indie darlings talk to Melissa Layton at Rockness Festival

Review: Black Sabbath

Pulling out rarities, like 'Wheels of Confusion'--a track which Ozzy isn't even sure has been played live before--the crowd are treated to a golden era of Sabbath tracks, which warrants a good deal of sing-alongs, pint swaying and illicit spliff saluting.

Review: Watch The Throne

Zane Lowe must be regretting his words. After seeing Jay-Z and Kanye West perform, he called it "the best rap show of all time," and in one of his (many) addresses to the crowd, Kanye calls Lowe out, saying "I heard on the radio that this was the best rap concert of all time.... Nah this is the best MUSIC concert of all time."

Campus Style Icon

By James Bithell

Style Icon for this week is Olivia Head (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Agatha Torrance)

Fashion Advice

The interesting thing about receiving advice, is what you then choose to do with it (Thumbnail credit Frida Giannini)

Burning the Man

A temporary city is created in the middle of the desert once a year. Sophie Rose Walker finds out whether anyone really knows what happens at Burning Man, the community that leaves no trace

Growing Alternatives

Primary Bone Cancer is the most common form of teenage cancer, yet the least understood. Fiona Parker uncovers the groundbreaking stem cell research being done here at the University of York.

Prometheus

Being producer and director Ridley Scott's return to the Alien franchise, this mission is doomed to fail thanks to scary monsters and the vague, insidious corporate interests funding it

Snow White and The Huntsman

Although the film is let down at times by awkward pacing and rushed, confused scripting, Theron's performance and the cinematography make this a solid debut for newcomer Rupert Sanders

The Problem with Spoilers

Generally, those who go on about spoilers are the worst type of people, to be ranked alongside people who use the phrase "just sayin'" and people who think Crocs are a suitable item of clothing

The Horrors of Their Pasts

Francis Ford Coppola was making 'nudie' movies and low-budget horrors such as Dementia 13 ten years before he made The Godfather

Godspell

A few important contradictions and inconsistencies in the direction and performance of this production prevented it from plumbing the obsidian depths it intended to. It made me smile, and it made me think, but not always for the right reasons.

Takeover Festival 2012: Andrew Motion Reading

Motion moved us in his poetry and his sporadic emeralds of literary wisdom, but not as a speaker of prose.

Takeover Festival 2012: Verve 12

Although brilliant in demonstrating the great skill of its dancers, Verve 12 unfortunately fell short in forging a strong connection with the audience. (Thumbnail credit Photo Credit: Chris Nash)

Nah this is the best MUSIC concert of all time."
